intro: Pedicularis sumana, commonly known as the Himalayan lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, often at elevations above 3,000 meters. Its flowers are usually pink or red, with a distinctive spurred shape that attracts pollinators like bees and flies. The leaves are fleshy and often arranged in a spiral, adapting to the harsh, cold conditions of its habitat.
